segments.text: I see the water just gushing out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that plate, like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to slip and fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and she’s still standing in it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to look down and notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, but she’s too distracted to see them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything around her is a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The counter is getting ruined, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone walks in and turns off that faucet before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just chaotic, but she’s completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR
